intro: Veronica teucrioides, commonly known as the upright speedwell, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, blue to violet flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped, alternate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Veronica teucrioides thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands, woodland edges, and disturbed sites.
